pdfText: …clock of the resurrection. Shall we stand now while we…Let us bow our heads now for prayer.  2   Our Heavenly Father, we come to Thee, at this hour, early in the morning, as the disciples came to the tomb to find it empty, the great Conqueror had rose from the dead.  3   We gather here this morning for the purpose of worshipping Him, singing out the glad tidings around the world today, that Jesus arose from the dead. We thank Thee for His great life and for His great approval that You put upon Him that He was the Son of God. As He said in the days while He was alive, “Destroy this temple, and I’ll raise it up again in three days.” We thank Thee for this, that You gave Him power to fulfill what He said He would do.  4   As we gather here this morning, around in the little tabernacle to sing our praises to Thee for Thy great work, many of us visited the grave this morning and finding, setting the flowers, thinking of our loved ones, and the time that when we placed their bodies beneath the sod, then by faith we look across the sea yonder to Joseph’s tomb, empty, Joseph of Arimathaea.  5   He arose from the grave, and our loved ones who sleep in Him, shall arise, too, some glorious morning, there will be a real Easter for all of us, someday, who are Thy followers. Forgive us of our sins now, and bless us and keep us ever close and faithful. For we ask it, in Christ’s Name. Amen.

chunks.text: The clock of the resurrection.
Now we stand now.
Our heavenly Father, we come to thee at this hour, early in the morning as the disciples
came to the tomb to find it empty.
The great conqueror had rose from
the dead.
We thank him for his great life
and for his great approval that you put upon him
that he was the Son of God.
As he said in the day when he was alive,
destroy this temple
and I'll raise it up again
in three days
we thank thee for this
that you gave me power
to fulfill
what he said he would do
as we gather here this morning
around in the little tabernacle
to sing our praises
and to these for our great work.
Many of us did the praise this morning in finding, studying the flowers, thinking of our loved ones
that when we place their bodies beneath the sky, then by faith we looked across the sea under to Joseph's
tomb, empty. Joseph of Armenia. He arose from the grave, and all who want to sleep in him
shall arise to his glorious morning. There will be a real Easter to all of us someday
who are not followers.
Forgive us of most sins now
and bless us
and keep us ever close to you, people,
for the accident in Christ's name.
Amen.

transcription.text: The clock of the resurrection. Now we stand now. Our heavenly Father, we come to thee at this hour, early in the morning as the disciples came to the tomb to find it empty. The great conqueror had rose from the dead. We thank him for his great life and for his great approval that you put upon him that he was the Son of God. As he said in the day when he was alive, destroy this temple and I'll raise it up again in three days we thank thee for this that you gave me power to fulfill what he said he would do as we gather here this morning around in the little tabernacle to sing our praises and to these for our great work. Many of us did the praise this morning in finding, studying the flowers, thinking of our loved ones that when we place their bodies beneath the sky, then by faith we looked across the sea under to Joseph's tomb, empty. Joseph of Armenia. He arose from the grave, and all who want to sleep in him shall arise to his glorious morning. There will be a real Easter to all of us someday who are not followers. Forgive us of most sins now and bless us and keep us ever close to you, people, for the accident in Christ's name. Amen.
